page.title: 05THE CHURCH W.WORLINGTON
page.content: West Worlington church is called St. Marys like East Worlington church. It dates back to the thirteenth century. It has a twisted spire with wooden shingles.The spire has been restored since it was struck by lightning in 1976.The family of Sir Hugh Stucley who live at Affeton Castle have been associated with the church for many hundreds of years.The rectory known as Glebe House was sold in 1919 when East and West livings were joined.The rector now is Mr.Hudson who lives at Witheridge and is in charge of 6 churches.Family service is held every third Sunday in the month and choir practice three Fridays in the month. We have a family Christmas service in West church and the school takes part along with other groups in the community.
